title: Test writing to theme color palette
description:
We proved we can READ the theme palette (colorScheme.colors) and SET elements to use theme references ({themeColor: "ACCENT1"}).

Open question: Can we MODIFY what ACCENT1 means in the master? If so, all elements using that reference would update automatically.

title: Decouple auth and configure scopes
description:
Decouple from mcp-google-workspace token and configure correct OAuth scopes.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- [ ] Update deploy.json to use local ./credentials.json and ./token.json
- [ ] Update package.json auth scripts to use itv-appscript auth (shows GCP project number)
- [ ] Keep existing scopes: presentations, drive, spreadsheets (needed for linked charts)
- [ ] Add Apps Script deployment scopes: script.projects, script.deployments
- [ ] Auth with itv-google-auth to get fresh token with correct scopes
- [ ] Test: itv-appscript deploy and itv-appscript run both work
- [ ] Document the change in CLAUDE.md

title: Auth Rationalization
description:
Untangle auth so itv-slides-formatter has its own minimal-scope token, with proper service account for production deployment.

**Current state:** Uses mcp-google-workspace token (15+ scopes), creating scope creep and tangled dependencies.

**Target state:**
- Own token.json with appropriate scopes (presentations, drive, spreadsheets, script.*)
- GCP project stays separate (itv-mit-slides-formatter)
- Service account for production deployment
- GitHub Actions CI/CD for production deploys
- ~20 users can install via shared URL

See plan: ~/.claude/plans/spicy-growing-sprout.md

title: Create GCP service account for production
description:
Set up a service account for production deployments.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- [ ] Create service account in itv-mit-slides-formatter GCP project
- [ ] Grant minimal roles (Apps Script API, Slides API)
- [ ] Download service account key JSON
- [ ] Store in GitHub Secrets as GOOGLE_SA_KEY
- [ ] Optional: Store locally in ~/.credentials/ for manual production deploys

title: Configure production deployment with CI/CD
description:
Set up production Apps Script project and GitHub Actions for automated deployment.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- [ ] Create production Apps Script project (share with service account as Editor)
- [ ] Create deploy.production.json pointing to service account credentials
- [ ] Create GitHub Actions workflow for production deploy on merge to main
- [ ] Document manual production deploy workflow (fallback)
- [ ] Test: Push to main triggers deploy to production

title: Set up user installation flow
description:
Enable ~20 users to install the add-on and receive automatic updates.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- [ ] Create versioned add-on deployment in production project
- [ ] Document install URL for users
- [ ] Test: Fresh user can install and use add-on
- [ ] Verify updates propagate automatically when new version is created
